text: and I have great pleasure in welcoming
his experiences such as Emery to wada
prime minister Democratic Republic of
sautoma and principi and I invite him to
address the assembly
Mr President of the United Nations
General Assembly
Mr Secretary General of the United
Nations
ladies and gentlemen heads of state and
government
ladies and gentlemen representatives of
member states
in an international context marked by
growing divisions
Rising tensions and diminishing Trust
it is with a great sense of
responsibility that I take the floor in
this great assembly as prime minister
and head of government representing the
Democratic Republic of santome principle
I would like
to honor the memory of the victims of
the recent earthquake in Morocco and the
floods in Libya
allow me to take advantage of the 78th
session of the general
debate to congratulate Ambassador Dennis
Francis on his election
and to express our full support for him
throughout his mandate
we also thank the outgoing president Mr
korosi for his commitment in conducting
the work of the previous session
particularly in face of the complexity
created by new conflicts and the world
of food crisis
Mr President excellencies
ladies and gentlemen helpful state and
government the theme chosen for this
session unleashing the power of gender
equality which we applaud is highly
relevant at the time when humanity is
going through the greatest of threats
reversing progress in human development
and widening inequalities in our
respective States the protocol
on the rights of women in Africa known
as the maputo protocol is celebrating
its 20th anniversary
and we have to acknowledge that there is
a huge deficit in terms of empowerment
and equal opportunities
particularly with regard to women's
participation in political
decision-making bodies
however we could also refer to the
Istanbul convention
which despite being binding for the
signatory states has done little to
translate the will of the Council of
Europe into results this issue like
others is a global objective that
requires the commitment of the
International Community governments
organizations and Civil Society to
create a fairer and more Equitable world
for all
faced with the persistent and growing
challenges that remain particularly in
terms of poverty anger inequalities and
environmental issues beyond our speeches
we the head the leaders of the various
Nations represented here
must question ourselves and recognize
our failures to protect our planet and
ensure shared Prosperity by 2030.
my country a small island state that has
enjoyed effective democracy for more
than 30 years and is still developing is
one of the main victims of climate
change ecosystem degradation and
economic dependence
my country is experiencing a situation
of real economic and financial
urgency in the short term well known to
our main partners
while at the same time going through a
complex process of transition to the
middle stage of development and pursuing
a policy adapted to its reality
respecting Multicultural diversity and
human rights
we have tried with some success to adapt
the codes recommendations and good
attitudes
aimed at achieving the 17 sustainable
development goals but structural
problems asymmetries of all kinds and a
lack of confidence in the Democratic
institutions on the part of our
populations are increasing
we should not hesitate
to point the finger at those responsible
for climate disruption within the G20 or
at the global economic governing bodies
that continue to ignore our social and
environmental objectives notably by
denying us access to financial resources
in reasonable quantities and conditions
even more worrying is the fact that we
are witnessing an increasing
polarization and fragmentation of the
world and Global governance with its
growing share of populism and
nationalism
the digital technology Society itself
which could have been the accelerator
for the development of our countries and
citizenship worldwide is becoming a new
source of inequality concentration of
wealth and domination
inequality lack of respect and lack of
inclusion can only lead to even greater
fractures and setbacks
coup d'etat and attempts to overthrow
the Constitutional orders are becoming
more and more frequent while at the same
time long-standing conflicts such as
those in Palestine and Cuba persist and
those in Yemen Syria Sudan and Libya
follow the same path
armed conflicts in violation of
international law whatever they may be
are also treated but differently
our condemnation of Russian invasion of
Ukraine was clear and without hesitation
because we respect international law and
the U.N Charter
unfortunately refugees and the dead are
not equal in rights and dignity in a
world that calls itself civilized
nowadays it seems that only Global
pandemics are capable of uniting and
mobilizing us
we are slow to react in order to impose
peace in the face of the latent conflict
in the Great Lakes region while the list
of debts displaced people in destruction
of all kinds continues to grow and
International Peace missions are showing
their limits due to the lack of clear
and effective commitments in favor of
the populations who are the first
victims
excellencies ladies and gentlemen
it may be too late but in defense and
hypocrisy are unacceptable our problems
as poor countries tend to become the
problems of rich countries too
demographic disparity economic disparity
climate the regulation
loss of institutional trust among others
and there is still hope of finding new
impetus if we resolutely commit to
reforming our institutions
starting with United Nations and the
Bretton Woods institutions towards the
reinvented and more supportive
multilateralism
it is our duty As Leaders to cultivate
an art capable of articulating the hoped
for Solutions
that can Enlighten so many human beings
whose experience is nothing more than a
journey of suffering and uncertainty
through leadership means finding the
necessary compromises it means having
the ability to make peace and promote
progress
excellencies as the saying goes nature
abhors a vacuum and our rhetoric our
appeals at Summit after Summit sounds
empty
we are convinced that peaceful Equitable
and sustainable societies with educated
and trained young people in good health
are in the general interest and that we
must therefore use common sense to avoid
major and unpredictable disruptions and
we still have the technical financial
and human resources to reform the
international political system rich
countries have a responsibility but ours
cannot be excluded either
we reaffirm the firm commitment of the
Democratic Republic of santome Principe
to actively collaborate with its
Regional and international Partners in
all initiatives aimed at eradicating all
acts all acts that are inhuman degrading
to human beings and the environment and
detrimental to humanist values and
freedom we firmly believe that our
organization is the converging center of
our causes and is the only entity whose
role is to structure and systematize our
common challenges and lead the
harmonization of our world respecting
cultural differences models and systems
of government and economic choices
Mr President excellencies ladies and
gentlemen heads of state and government
before concluding
I would like to say how particularly
grateful my country is to our Secretary
General Antonio gutes for his tireless
efforts
to strengthen the role of the United
Nations in promoting peace democracy and
the protection of human life worldwide
as well as in the fight against poverty
and climate change in all its forms
his determination
challenges and compel us thank you for
your attention
[Applause]
I wish to thank prime minister of the
Democratic Republic of South domain
Principe for the statement just made
